strapiArticle.title: Kare-Kare
strapiArticle.description: Stew with a rich peanut sauce.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Ingredients:

  • 1 kg oxtail or tripe (or a combination of both), cut into serving pieces
  • 1 bundle of bok choy or pechay (Chinese cabbage), ends trimmed
  • 1 bundle of string beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
  • 1 eggplant, sliced diagonally
  • 2 tablespoons cooking oil
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 medium-sized onion, chopped
  • 3 tablespoons annatto seeds (achuete)
  • 1 cup peanut butter
  • 6 cups beef or pork broth
  • Fish sauce (patis), to taste
  • Ground black pepper, to taste
  • Shrimp paste (bagoong), for serving
  • Steamed rice, for serving

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Add the oxtail or tripe and simmer for about 2 hours or until the meat is tender. Skim off any impurities that rise to the surface.

  2. Once the meat is tender, remove it from the pot and set it aside. Reserve the broth.

  3. In a separate pan, heat the cooking oil over medium heat. Saut√© the garlic and onions until fragrant and translucent.

  4. Add the annatto seeds to the pan and cook for about a minute. Stir continuously to extract the color.

  5. Remove the annatto seeds from the pan, leaving the oil behind. Discard the seeds.

  6. Add the peanut butter to the pan and cook for about 2 minutes, stirring continuously.

  7. Gradually add the reserved broth, stirring continuously to prevent lumps from forming. Continue cooking until the sauce thickens.

  8. Return the oxtail or tripe to the pot with the peanut sauce. Stir to coat the meat evenly.

  9. Add the string beans and eggplant to the pot and cook until they are tender, usually about 5-7 minutes.

  10. Season the stew with fish sauce (patis) and ground black pepper according to your taste preference. Adjust the thickness of the sauce by adding more broth if needed.

  11. Add the bok choy or pechay to the pot and cook for another 2 minutes until the greens are wilted.

  12. Serve the Kare-Kare hot with steamed rice. Offer shrimp paste (bagoong) on the side for dipping. Enjoy!

Kare-Kare is a delightful and savory dish that is best enjoyed with family and friends.
